topic: What is the difference between storywriting and journaling?

dialog.text: What is the difference between storywriting and journaling?
dialog.instructions: curious, inquisitive; natural pace; subtle pause after question

dialog.text: Storywriting builds a path others can walk: characters, a world, a plot, and a destination.
dialog.instructions: clear, explanatory; inviting tone; confident cadence

dialog.text: So journaling is more about my own daily truth, not a crafted plot?
Exactly. Journaling records moments and feelings as they happen; storywriting shapes those moments into meaning through structure.
They overlap—journal entries can become scenes, and stories can reveal honest truths when written with care.
The difference is purpose: journaling is your inner map, and storywriting is your outer door—use both to understand and share.
If this lands, try blending them today: jot a quick journal entry, then rewrite it as a tiny scene, and tell us what you discovered in the comments.
dialog.instructions: call to action; clear, inviting; concise
